Explanations about Options.-acodec: Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Play a video or audio file
Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_656396: How to play a playlist continously?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_656396: mpv --gapless-audio=yes --loop-playlist=inf video_file_*

find -type f -name 'video_file_*' -print0 | sort -V -z | xargs -0 -- sh -c 'exec mpv </dev/tty --gapless-audio=yes --loop-playlist=inf -- "$@"'

mpv --wid=0xdeadbeef ...

Explanations about Options.--wid:
This tells mpv to attach to an existing window. If a VO is selected that supports
 this option, it will use that window for video output. mpv will scale the video to
 the size of this window, and will add black bars to compensate if the aspect ratio
 of the video is different.

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_353558: Playing arbitrary PCM sound throught the PC speaker?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_353558: # Load the PC speaker driver
sudo modprobe snd-pcsp
# Reload ALSA to find the new driver
sudo alsa force-reload
# You should now see pcsp (pcspeaker) as an ALSA output option
sudo aplay -l

Explanations about Options.-l: List all soundcards and digital audio devices
